content: The Act titled "PROTECTION Act" aims to provide reliable officers, technology, education, community prosecutors, and training in neighborhoods. The COPS Program under the PROTECTION Act is amended to increase police and prosecutor presence, enhance law enforcement access to new technologies, and provide grants for hiring and redeployment of law enforcement officers for community policing efforts. The COPS Program under the PROTECTION Act is amended to promote higher education among law enforcement officers by reimbursing them for education costs and limiting overtime grants to 25 percent of available funds. The COPS Program under the PROTECTION Act is amended to limit funds for grants in any fiscal year, with restrictions on the percentage allocated for specialized training, integrity and ethics, and school officials. The PROTECTION Act amends the COPS Program to limit grant funds and establish school-based partnerships between law enforcement agencies and school systems to address various crime and disorder issues.
